Dear Jason M Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me.
In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions.
In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between 11/13/23 and 11/15/23, youth obtained two nicotine pens
and one marijuana vape pen from a staff member's purse. Another
youth saw this occur and tried a synthetic form of marijuana, but
it's unclear where they obtained it from.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) was
interviewed via phone on 11/16/23. FCW reported she was on
her way to see Youth A at the facility when she received a call
from Case Manager regarding Youth A being involved with an
incident involving a nicotine vape pen and a marijuana vape pen.
FCW reported they were suspicious he used the vapes, so they
asked permission for him to get drug tested. When she arrived at
the facility, FCW met with Therapist, Case Manager and Youth A
regarding the incident. Youth A disclosed he watched another
youth in the program take vapes out of a staff member’s purse.
FCW reported she did not know the names of the other youth or
the staff member. Youth A reported he did not use either of the
vapes and did not take either of the vapes. FCW reported she was
concerned about supervision by staff and how vapes were
accessible to youth.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 11/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CA
noted they became aware the vapes were taken on Wednesday
11/15/23, and Program Manager began a full investigation as to
where the vapes came from and how youth accessed them. CA
reported initially they knew the vapes were taken somewhere
between Monday 11/13/23 and Wednesday 11/15/23. CA reported
through the investigation, they learned Staff 2 had the vapes in
her purse on Tuesday 11/14/23. CA reported Staff 2 is coming in
today (11/17/23) to be terminated as they are a substance free
campus.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed via phone on
11/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. PM reported she
2

wasn’t present for the initial incident, but she handled the follow-
up investigation. Through her investigation, she found out the
incident occurred on Tuesday evening 11/14/23. On Wednesday
11/15/23, she followed up with Staff 1 because he was the shift
supervisor on Tuesday night. At the time she spoke to Staff 1,
they only knew perfume was taken from Staff 2’s purse. Later
Wednesday morning, Youth B disclosed he stole vapes from Staff
2’s purse, kept one of the vapes and gave the other to Youth C.
Youth B gave staff members the vape he had. Youth C reported
the vape he was given was in a hygiene basket, which was
confirmed and confiscated by staff. PM decided room searches
needed to occur to ensure there was no other contraband.
Nothing was found in Youth A or Youth B’s rooms. In Youth C’s
room, they found another vape as well as an extended drill bit. It is
unknown where Youth C obtained the vape found in his room. PM
reported Case Manager and the nursing department handled
getting drug screens for Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. PM
reported she followed up with Supervisor 1 regarding what was
learned, and Supervisor 1 called Staff 2. Staff 2 didn’t offer
information to Supervisor 1 about the vapes until Supervisor 1
specifically asked her about them.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he was sitting in the milieu when Staff 1 went into the medication
room in the staff office. Youth A reported Youth B went into the
staff office and stole 2 vapes out of a staff member’s purse, but he
didn’t know the staff member’s name. Youth A reported he didn’t
know what happened to the vapes after Youth B took them. Youth
A reported he thinks Youth B tried the vapes because he could
smell something weird in the milieu, but he didn’t see Youth B try
them.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/28/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
one of the staff members from Boelkins guest staffed on
Zondervaan, but he couldn’t remember her name. Youth B
reported her purse was in the staff office. Youth B reported Staff 1
went into the medication room and left the staff office open. Youth
B reported he was out in the milieu with Youth A, but he saw the
staff office open, so he went and sat in the staff chair. Youth B
reported he saw the staff member’s purse, went through it and
took vapes and a bottle of perfume. Youth B reported he couldn’t
remember how many vapes he took, but thinks it was probably 2-
4. Youth B reported at least one of the vape was a marijuana
vape. Youth B reported after he took the items, he went to the
3

milieu to sit with Youth A. Youth B reported Staff 1 came out of the
medication room and gave them their medications, and then
Youth B went into the bathroom to take a shower. Youth B
reported a little later, everyone else came back to the unit. Youth
B reported when the guest staff came back and went through her
purse, she came out of the office. Youth B reported Staff 1 came
to talk to him and asked him if he took anything out of the staff
office. Youth B reported he told Staff 1 he didn’t go in the staff
office. Youth B reported Staff 1 did not specifically ask him if he
took vapes, so he didn’t think Staff 1 knew. Youth B reported later
in the night, Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, and the guest staff talked to
him and Youth A about whether they went into the staff office and
took anything, but they didn’t do any searches or ask specifically
about the vapes. Youth B reported they went to bed. Youth B
reported he smoked the vapes while they were in his possession,
and he gave one to Youth C. Youth B reported the next morning
he was talking to Education Specialist and asked her for some of
her Oreos. Youth B reported Education Specialist said, “I’m not
going to give you any, knowing you stole from someone”. Youth B
reported Education Specialist told him they saw him on camera
taking stuff. Youth B reported he thought there was a blind spot
but wasn’t surprised they caught him on camera. Youth B reported
he admitted what happened, gave Education Specialist the vape
he hid in the bathroom and told her Youth C had the other vape.
Youth B reported no one asked him about the vapes specifically
until after he admitted what he took.
An attempt was made to interview Youth C face to face on
11/28/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker, but Youth C
refused to talk.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/28/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he was
working as the shift supervisor for Zondervaan on 11/14/23. Staff
1 reported they were short staffed, so Staff 2 picked up a shift to
help them out. Staff 1 reported there were three youth on the unit
with him (Youth A, Youth B and Youth D) while all other youth and
staff were on other parts of the campus. Staff 1 reported Youth D
was in the shower while Youth A and Youth B were in the milieu
with him. Staff 1 reported Youth B stated he was going to take a
shower, so Staff 1 unlocked the bathroom for him. Staff 1 reported
he went through the staff office into the medication room to get a
cough drop, and Youth A was still in the milieu. Staff 1 reported
generally the staff office is closed, so youth can’t access it, but
because he was the only staff member on shift, he left it open so
he could hear what was going on in the milieu since Youth A was
4

still out there. Staff 1 reported when he came out of the staff
office, Youth B was in the milieu and stated he wasn’t in the
shower yet because he needed a towel. When Staff 2 returned to
the unit from the activity with other youth, she told Staff 1 there
was perfume missing from her purse. Staff 2 never disclosed there
were vapes also missing from her purse. Staff 1 reported he
asked Youth A and Youth B about the missing perfume, but they
both denied going into the staff office. Staff 1 reported Youth E
went to use the bathroom and came out stating there was broken
glass on the floor in the bathroom and there was a piece of glass
in his sandal. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2 went to the
bathroom, saw the broken glass, and smelled perfume. Staff 1
reported it was the same bathroom Youth B had used to take a
shower, so he was positive Youth B had stolen the perfume.
When Staff 1 asked Youth B about it again, Youth B continued to
deny he took anything. The next morning, Staff 1 reported
Education Specialist pulled Youth B out of class and asked him
some questions. Youth B came onto the unit, grabbed the vape he
hid in the vent in the bathroom and gave it to Education Specialist.
Youth B also told Education Specialist he gave the other vape to
Youth C. Staff 1 reported they were able to confiscate the vape
from Youth C and they also found another vape in Youth C’s room
when doing room searches.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 12/6/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she worked on 11/14/23.
Staff 2 reported she went with one youth to kid’s club for an hour,
and then came back onto the unit. Staff 2 reported her purse was
in the staff office and she thought the staff office was locked, but it
wasn’t. Staff 2 reported she looked in her purse and found 2
vapes (1 nicotine and 1 marijuana) and her perfume were missing.
Staff 2 reported she found out her insurance card was missing but
didn’t notice that until after she was terminated from employment.
She reported after she found out things were missing, she told
Staff 1 the perfume was missing from her purse. Staff 2 reported
she couldn’t remember if she told Staff 1 vapes were missing.
Staff 2 reported she questioned whether vapes were missing from
her purse because she had never brought them on campus
before. She reported she didn’t confirm they were missing until
after she got home that night. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1
went to Youth A’s room and asked him if he knew about anything
being taken from the staff office, and he said no. Staff 2 reported
she and Staff 1 went to Youth B’s room and asked the same
question. Staff 2 reported Youth B said he had heard of other kids
taking staff’s belongings before but doesn’t know anything about
who or what they took. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1 went back
5

to the staff office and not more than 30 seconds later, a different
youth (not sure of his name), came out of the bathroom and said
he stepped on broken glass in the bathroom. Staff 2 reported she
and Staff 1 went into the bathroom and smelled perfume. Staff 1
reported she was shaken up by the whole incident, so they
allowed her to go home early. Staff 2 reported she got a call from
Supervisor 1 the next day to talk about the situation and disclosed
the vapes were missing from her purse after Supervisor 1 asked
her about them. Staff 2 reported she was terminated from
employment on 11/17/23, which was understandable given the
circumstances.
Education Specialist (ES) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 11/28/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. ES
reported on 11/15/23, she was talking to Youth B and asked, “why
are you getting in a staff’s purse?” and he replied “That’s what I
do. That’s what I’m here for. I like to steal”. ES reported she told
him she heard he took perfume and Youth B said, “well what
about the other stuff?”. ES reported she was surprised because
she didn’t know he took anything else but decided to go along with
it. ES reported she told Youth B “Yeah we saw on camera stealing
the other stuff and need that back too”. ES reported Youth B took
her to Zondervaan and grabbed a vape out of the vent in the
bathroom on the unit. Youth B told her the perfume bottle broke in
the bathroom and he flushed the pieces down the toilet. Youth B
only physically gave her one of the vapes, and said he gave the
other vape to Youth C. ES reported she spoke to Youth C and he
said “[Youth B] gave it to me, but I didn’t want it, so I put it in
[Youth B]’s hygiene bin because I don’t like them”. ES reported
she looked in the hygiene bin and it wasn’t in there, but then she
pulled the bin out and found the vape behind the bin. ES reported
Youth B and Youth C denied there were any other vapes, so she
completed an incident report. ES reported she and Staff 1
conducted room searches and found another vape in Youth C’s
room, but they weren’t sure if that one came from Staff 2’s purse
or not.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/28/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported she was off work on 11/15/23 but received a call from
Supervisor 2 asking which staff worked on 11/14/23 because
there might have been some vapes taken. Supervisor 1 provided
Staff 2’s name to Supervisor 2, and then contacted PM to ask
what was going on. PM told Supervisor 1 they didn’t have a lot of
details yet but would notify her when they did. As a preventative
measure, Supervisor 1 called Staff 2 and offered her the night off
6

work since they were overstaffed. Later in the day, PM called
Supervisor 1 and notified her a bottle of perfume and 2 vapes
were taken from Staff 2’s purse. Supervisor 1 called Staff 2 and
asked her about the perfume taken the night before. Staff 2 told
Supervisor 1 it was taken out of her purse, which was in the staff
office, and then it was found broken in the bathroom. Supervisor 1
reported she asked Staff 2 if anything else was taken because
Staff 2 did not offer the information. Supervisor 1 told Staff 2 she
needed to be honest because it was for the health, safety, and
welfare of the youth in the program. Staff 2 admitted 2 vapes were
taken from her purse as well; one nicotine vape, and one
marijuana vape. Supervisor 1 reported she told Staff 2 those were
prohibited substances on a property. Staff 2 told Supervisor 1 she
didn’t know how to bring it up in conversation they were missing,
but profusely apologized. Supervisor 1 reported since Staff 2 was
in her probationary period, Staff 2 was terminated from
employment on 11/17/23.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Report dated 11/15/23 authored by ES states staff
were suspicious of contraband. [Youth B] admitted to
having 2 vapes and gave them to staff.
• Incident Report dated 11/15/23 authored by Staff 1 states
[Youth C]’s room was searched because of drug
paraphernalia suspicion and staff found a weed pen and a
drill bit.
• Drug screen results for Youth A, Youth B and Youth C,
taken 11/15/23 and results received 11/20/23, noted none
of them tested positive for marijuana.
• Shift Summary dated 11/14/23 (PM) states guest staff [Staff
2]’s perfume was stolen from her purse, and it wasn’t found
on any of the kids. Note stated [Youth B] was highly
suspected of taking it because the glass being on the
bathroom floor after his shower and Staff 4 smelling
perfume on his hands.
• Shift Summary dated 11/15/23 (AM) states [Youth A]
admitted [Youth B] took the perfume. A room search was
conducted for [Youth A], and nothing was found. [Youth C]
was confronted about a vape and told staff what he did with
it. Staff retrieved the vape and asked about any other
vapes, which he denied. Room search was done and a
7

vape was found in his room. A room search was done on
[Youth B]’s room and nothing was found.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Employee Handbook
Addendum: Marijuana Use states Wedgwood is a drug-free
workplace, which prohibits employees from possessing
marijuana at work, using marijuana at work, or reporting to
work with a detectible level of marijuana in their system.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 1 received a team training on facility
policies on 8/24/23.
• Staff 2 was terminated on 11/17/23 because of this incident
violating the Employee Handbook as well as the
Alcohol/Prohibited Substances Policy. Included in her
termination memo dated 11/17/23, were two other write ups
for incidents unrelated to this investigation. There is a note
in her employee file stating Staff 2 is ineligible for rehire.
Staff 2 received training on policies during orientation and
shadow shifts on 10/18/23, 10/24/23, 10/27/23, 10/28/23
and 10/31/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is established. Staff 2 violated the facility’s employee
handbook regarding being a substance free campus, which
includes not possessing marijuana on campus. As a result of Staff
2 bringing a marijuana vape and a nicotine vape on campus,
youth at the facility had access to these substances.
Technical Assistance:
- All staff belongings should be secured in the staff closet
room, which is located behind a locked door inside the staff
office. Since the staff office may be open for staff to access
the medication room, this would eliminate the potential for
youth to access staffs’ belongings in the future.
- If staff from units are covering shifts on other units, it is
imperative they are aware of the expectations surrounding
storage of their belongings to ensure the safety of youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000256 dated 4/3/23; CAP approved 4/18/23
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
